org.javasimon.jmx
Class SimonManagerMXBeanImpl

java.lang.Object
  org.javasimon.jmx.SimonManagerMXBeanImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
SimonManagerMXBean
public class SimonManagerMXBeanImpl
extends Object
implements SimonManagerMXBean

Simon MXBean implementation. See SimonManagerMXBean for interface documentation. Most methods are implemented by calling the Manager.

Since:
2.0
Author:
Radovan Sninsky, Ivan Mushketyk
See Also:
Manager, Simon, SimonUtils

getIncrementCounterSample

public CounterSample getIncrementCounterSample(String name,
                                               String key)
Description copied from interface: SimonManagerMXBean
Samples increment in Counter values since the previous call of this method with the same key. When the method is called the first time for the key, current values are returned (same like from SimonManagerMXBean.getCounterSample(String) }. Any subsequent calls with the key provide increments.

Clients should use a unique key (GUID, host name, etc.), to avoid interference with other clients.

Specified by:
getIncrementCounterSample in interface SimonManagerMXBean
Parameters:
name - name of the stopwatch
key - name of an incremental sample
Returns:
sample collected for a specified key if it was created before

getCounterSamples

public List<CounterSample> getCounterSamples(String namePattern)
Sample all Counters whose name matches given pattern

Specified by:
getCounterSamples in interface SimonManagerMXBean
Parameters:
namePattern - Name pattern, null means all Counters
Returns:
One Sample for each Counter

getIncrementStopwatchSample

public StopwatchSample getIncrementStopwatchSample(String name,
                                                   String key)
Description copied from interface: SimonManagerMXBean
Samples increment in Stopwatch values since the previous call of this method with the same key. When the method is called the first time for the key, current values are returned (same like from SimonManagerMXBean.getCounterSample(String) }. Any subsequent calls with the key provide increments.

Clients should use a unique key (GUID, host name, etc.), to avoid interference with other clients.

Specified by:
getIncrementStopwatchSample in interface SimonManagerMXBean
Parameters:
name - name of the stopwatch
key - name of an incremental sample
Returns:
sample collected for a specified key if it was created before
